page.title: 11The Balmoral Ponies
page.content: Highland Fell and Haflinger ponies are kept at Balmoral stable. They are used for pony trekking. The pony trekking starts in April and finishes in July. They trek up and down the paths and hills. It costs Â£7 for a half day and Â£13 for a full day. The Duke of Edinburgh drives a team of Fell ponies and competes in various shows. My dad is head pony man for Balmoral Estate. He has to get up very early to feed any ponies that are away out on the hill and do not have much grass. Those in the stables are fed once in the morning, a little snack in the afternoon and again at night. The Haflinger ponies are used for deer stalking. The dead game is carried across their backs. Sometimes the forest vehicles cannot get in to pull out felled trees so the ponies are used for the job.
